118.title: Herman

118.series: 1991) "How's She Gonna Live on $1,000 a Month?"*
118.appears_in: p. 90 in Battered Husbands (Redondo Beach, CA : H. Gregory Associates, 1991).
notes: Summary: She deserted him after the wedding, took his life savings, and 42 years later sues for divorce; he's a quadriplegic ex-marine on a $12,000 pension in a trailer park and the judge awarded her $1,000 a month retroactive to 1948.

166.heading: Herman--Miscellanea.
166.title: "Stay Away from Talking Frogs"
166.author: George J
166.appears_in: Lockwood. p. 34-40 in Cartoonist Profiles, no. 109 (Mar. 1996).
notes: Retired editor of Milwaukee Journal reminisces about the strips and panels he bought for his paper, with samples and comments about 12 of them: Conrad, The Far Side, Herman, Calvin and Hobbes, Hagar, The Circus of P.T. Bimbo, For Better or For Worse, Garfield, Terry and the Pirates, Mother Goose & Grimm, The Muppets, and Shoe.

167.heading: Herman.
167.title: "Hot Sax and Spies"
167.author: art: Robert Webb
notes: Villians are Herman and a female spy (both introduced), and the Nazis.
Data from Lou Mougin via The Grand Comics Database Project.

168.heading: Herman.
168.title: "The Phony Parachutist"
168.author: art: Jim Chambers? 9 p

notes: Introduces The Royal Watch (Jock, Mac, Harry and Terry), Sgt. Harkness, Capt. Carruthers; villains are Herman and other Nazi spies, who all die.
Data from Lou Mougin via The Grand Comics Database Project.
